items.content_html:
Description

Some titles on HTML element pages didn't have a title and only displayed the element name. Adding a title to standardize these element pages with the others.

Motivation

These pages looked a bit less complete and polished as all the other pages had titles. These changes don't provide much more context but they're at least standardized.

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: Standardize titles for element pages

items.content_html:
The XUL section is long gone from MDN (and nobody use XUL anymore).

Neutralizing the links that are red links anyway.
items.title: Neutralizing internal XUL links

items.content_html: Many of these links were long gone, so it mostly consisted in neutralizing them.
items.title: Fix broken links

items.content_html: That page got moved earlier this year, we missed to fix this link
items.title: Fix link to "For further reading" section

items.content_html:
• Social API was a Mozilla experiment that is long gone (and won't come back under this name)
  • The link to File API was still using the decade-old /en-US/DOM hierarchy instead of /en-US/Web/API.
items.title: Fix broken links

items.content_html:
A few CSS features are documented but not implemented (yet).

For these features, we use spec-urls and a hardcoded browser compat text. For example, in: @media/shape

A few pages about CSS weren't doing this, leading to big red boxes and flaws. This PR fixes the 5 of them.

Note: when the feature is implemented, BCD is notified and fixed and browser vendors' writers update docs, and will add the {{compat}} to these pages at that moment, so this way of doing is safe.
items.title: Fix absence of bcd for some css features

items.content_html:
Description

Renamed a section from "Resolver function" to "The resolve function"

Motivation

The new title is technically more correct as "Resolver" has its own, separate meaning from the resolve function.

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: Renamed a section from "Resolver function" to "The resolve function"

items.content_html:
Description

According to HTML Standard, it also accepts the following off and on keywords.
https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/interaction.html#autocapitalization

This is a follow-up to the following PR.

  • #30645
items.title: Update autocapitalize props

items.content_html:
Description

Like console.log(errorObj), console.assert(condition, errorObj) prints a stack trace. But console log's summary doesn't mention this detail, nor does the API for console.assert. Therefore, it felt more consistent to remove it here.

Motivation

See above

Additional details

Modified page: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/console#instance_methods
console.assert page: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/console/assert_static
console.log page: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/console/log_static

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: Change `console.assert` summary to match API summary

items.content_html:
Description

Updates some documentation to refer to WebXR rather than WebVR; Updates some sidebar links to previously-undiscoverable WebXR guides.

Motivation

  • Keep folks up-to-date with the latest WebXR APIs
  • Improve discoverability of important content

Additional details

This work came out of a comment on @bsmth's #30696.

Related issues and pull requests

Must be merged with mdn/yari#10111
items.title: Update some WebVR docs to relate to the more modern WebXR

items.content_html:
Description

reference to spec - https://notifications.spec.whatwg.org/

add ServiceWorkerGlobalScope: notificationclose to Notifications API group data

remove the inherited ExtendableEvent.waitUntil() method description from NotificationEvent interface summary page, also update NotificationEvent interface description, also some other content updates, reference to https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/MDN/Writing_guidelines/Page_structures/Page_types/API_reference_page_template

also refactor Notifications API for Interfaces section, reference to https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/MDN/Writing_guidelines/Page_structures/Page_types/API_landing_page_template

Motivation

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: some update to Notifications

items.content_html:
Description

Currently, the color-scheme CSS property has a single code example how to set this property. However, there are no practical examples how to use this property with other properties.

The new example uses both prefers-color-scheme media query and light-dark() color function.
items.title: Add an example to `color-scheme` CSS property

items.content_html:
• fixes #30675

The new contrast between button and background is 3.49:1
items.title: fix(css): update good contrast example

items.content_html:
Part of openwebdocs/project#185

Move the XML-related guide under Web/XML.
items.title: Move guide under Web/XML

items.content_html:
Description

I added the following links to the bottom of the HTMLElement meter page:

  • {{cssxref("::-webkit-meter-bar")}}
  • {{cssxref("::-webkit-meter-inner-element") }}
  • {{cssxref("::-webkit-meter-even-less-good-value")}}
  • {{cssxref("::-webkit-meter-optimum-value")}}
  • {{cssxref("::-webkit-meter-suboptimum-value")}}

Motivation

The HTMLElement progress page has links for its CSS-related pseudo-elements, but the meter page lacks them. Therefore, I added these links for better completeness and user navigation.

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: (HTML) Add `-webkit` prefixed props to `<meter>` page

items.content_html: As used in the example below, the method name in the description is getOffsetReferenceSpace() and not referenceOffsetReferenceSpace(). Fixing the broken link.
items.title: Rename requesttOffsetReferenceSpace() to getOffsetReferenceSpace()

items.content_html:
These articles are non-existent and, as they have no internal redirects, likely were never written.

This page would need a severe rework, but it is outside the scope of this PR.
items.title: Remove links to non-existent articles

items.content_html:
• Removed the Permissions section that is irrelevant nowadays
  • Removed mention of the name of the dictionary MediaStreamError (as well as the non-existent list of errors)
items.title: Slightly improve outdated Navigator.getUserMedia()

items.content_html: There is no glossary entry for symbol, but we have a page about it in JS.
items.title: Fix link to Symbol

items.content_html:
Similar to #30681 but on Window.

We document events on their EventTarget. Although some may bubble, we only document them once.

This PR removes events from the Window event list that are not targetting it. (They can only reach it via the bubbling mechanism).

This was an oddity dating from before we decided how to deal with events in 2021.
items.title: Removed events that do not target Window from the list
